Detailed Description

Programme Execution Parameters.

Field Documentation

unsigned int exec_call::options

Flags to modify the execution Behaviour.

char** exec_call::command

The Command to execute.

This is a list of strings, the end of the list must be a 0-pointer, and the first element of the list is used as the binary to execute.

If this field is 0 itself, then instead of executing a programme the execute() function will rather fork.

char** exec_call::environment

The Environment to use for the Child Process.

A 0-terminated list of KEY=value pairs that will compose a child process's environment. Only used when command is set to something other than 0.
